channel.title: Fucking linux
channel.description:
Trying to run my PI through eclipse, and it can't find my cfg files.
I have ubuntu which is probably the problem or it could be my eclipse, idk. I have to go soon and don't have time to find the answer myself.

Oh, thanks.

[size=2pt]you have my eternal love[/size]

item.title: Fucking linux
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“mark033, post:8, topic:389405”][quote author=n10si t link=topic=485323.msg3555979#msg3555979 date=1301882595]Did that, and made it load the file through the entire path, but still getting the same thing.
[/quote]

Then you’re doing it wrong.[/quote]

Obviously.

Here’s how I’m loading it:

public boolean loadNPCList(String FileName) {
		String line = "";
		String token = "";
		String token2 = "";
		String token2_2 = "";
		String[] token3 = new String[10];
		boolean EndOfFile = false;
		BufferedReader characterfile = null;
		try {
			characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./"+FileName));
		} catch(FileNotFoundException fileex) {
			Misc.println(FileName+": file not found.");
			return false;
		}
		try {
			line = characterfile.readLine();
		} catch(IOException ioexception) {
			Misc.println(FileName+": error loading file.");
			return false;
		}
		while(EndOfFile == false && line != null) {
			line = line.trim();
			int spot = line.indexOf("=");
			if (spot > -1) {
				token = line.substring(0, spot);
				token = token.trim();
				token2 = line.substring(spot + 1);
				token2 = token2.trim();
				token2_2 = token2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token3 = token2_2.split("\t");
				if (token.equals("npc")) {
					newNPCList(Integer.parseInt(token3[0]), token3[1], Integer.parseInt(token3[2]), Integer.parseInt(token3[3]));
				}
			} else {
				if (line.equals("[ENDOFNPCLIST]")) {
					try { characterfile.close(); } catch(IOException ioexception) { }
					return true;
				}
			}
			try {
				line = characterfile.readLine();
			} catch(IOException ioexception1) { EndOfFile = true; }
		}
		try { characterfile.close(); } catch(IOException ioexception) { }
		return false;
	}

public boolean loadAutoSpawn(String FileName) {
		String line = "";
		String token = "";
		String token2 = "";
		String token2_2 = "";
		String[] token3 = new String[10];
		boolean EndOfFile = false;
		BufferedReader characterfile = null;
		try {
			characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./"+FileName));
		} catch(FileNotFoundException fileex) {
			Misc.println(FileName+": file not found.");
			return false;
		}
		try {
			line = characterfile.readLine();
		} catch(IOException ioexception) {
			Misc.println(FileName+": error loading file.");
			return false;
		}
		while(EndOfFile == false && line != null) {
			line = line.trim();
			int spot = line.indexOf("=");
			if (spot > -1) {
				token = line.substring(0, spot);
				token = token.trim();
				token2 = line.substring(spot + 1);
				token2 = token2.trim();
				token2_2 = token2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token3 = token2_2.split("\t");
				if (token.equals("spawn")) {
					newNPC(Integer.parseInt(token3[0]), Integer.parseInt(token3[1]), Integer.parseInt(token3[2]), Integer.parseInt(token3[3]), Integer.parseInt(token3[4]), getNpcListHP(Integer.parseInt(token3[0])), Integer.parseInt(token3[5]), Integer.parseInt(token3[6]), Integer.parseInt(token3[7]));
				
				}
			} else {
				if (line.equals("[ENDOFSPAWNLIST]")) {
					try { characterfile.close(); } catch(IOException ioexception) { }
					return true;
				}
			}
			try {
				line = characterfile.readLine();
			} catch(IOException ioexception1) { EndOfFile = true; }
		}
		try { characterfile.close(); } catch(IOException ioexception) { }
		return false;
	}

Those are the methods, and then in:

public NPCHandler {
loadNPCList("/home/fabio301/Desktop/Server/Data/cfg/npc.cfg");
loadAutoSpawn("/home/fabio301/Desktop/Server/Data/cfg/spawn-config.cfg");

Read full topic

item.title: Fucking linux
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“mark033, post:6, topic:389405”]If you’ve correctly replaced all references to it in your files with their entire paths (which is what I’ve resorted to doing in Ubuntu) then the only other thing I’ve done to sort out problems (this was player saving and loading mind you, a bit different) is run Eclipse as root, which is bad practice, but it can solve some problems.

Open a terminal and type “sudo eclipse” (if you were wondering). If you need any help with using Ubuntu to run private servers feel free to PM me.[/quote]

Did that, and made it load the file through the entire path, but still getting the same thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Fucking linux
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

If you’ve correctly replaced all references to it in your files with their entire paths (which is what I’ve resorted to doing in Ubuntu) then the only other thing I’ve done to sort out problems (this was player saving and loading mind you, a bit different) is run Eclipse as root, which is bad practice, but it can solve some problems.

Open a terminal and type “sudo eclipse” (if you were wondering). If you need any help with using Ubuntu to run private servers feel free to PM me.

Read full topic

item.title: Fucking linux
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:4, topic:389405”]I’m not going to waste my time making my paths match those using a linux OS.

Make sure you’re actually loading from that file, why not use;
System.out.println(…)
To find out where it’s actually loading the CFGs from.[/quote]

It’s loading them from the right place, I’ve also tried hardcoding the exact path and using the default, which is “./Data/cfg/file.cfg”

Read full topic

item.title: Fucking linux
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:2, topic:389405”]There is nothing wrong with Linux. ;o

With Eclipse, make sure that your CFG files are at the base of the project directory, not where the .class files are.
For example, if I was trying to load image1.jpg I would place it here;

C:\Users\Steven\workspace\Game2
and not here;
C:\Users\Steven\workspace\Game2\bin[/quote]

They’re in

/home/user/Desktop/Server/Data/cfg/

l2linux with ur paths btw

Read full topic

item.title: Fucking linux
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

There is nothing wrong with Linux. ;o

With Eclipse, make sure that your CFG files are at the base of the project directory, not where the .class files are.
For example, if I was trying to load image1.jpg I would place it here;

C:\Users\Steven\workspace\Game2
and not here;
C:\Users\Steven\workspace\Game2\bin

Read full topic
